intro: Paraquilegia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its solitary, showy flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, bulbous structures that store nutrients. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
